title: Gulf States See $6 Billion of Africa Energy Deals Within Weeks
content: Middle East countries have shown interest in or completed deals for at least $6 billion of African energy assets in recent weeks, demonstrating a larger investment appetite on the continent by the region.

title: India Bans Imports From Pakistan as Tit-for-Tat Measures Widen
content: India banned the import of all goods originating from or transiting through Pakistan as tensions between the two nuclear-armed nations escalate in the wake of a deadly terror attack last month.

title: Germany’s Red Tape Creates a Berlin-Sized Hole in Energy Shift
content: Military airspace restrictions are holding up wind-power projects, highlighting the challenges for Germany’s energy and defense plans.

title: Hong Kong Buys Record Amount of US Dollars to Defend Peg
content: Hong Kong intervened to defend its peg, buying a record amount of US dollars after the city’s currency rose to the upper end of its trading band.

title: Trump vs. Powell, 50 Years of Vanguard, South Korea Demographics | Wall Street Week
content: This week, former Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers and Columbia’s Kathryn Judge discuss the importance and evolution of the Fed's independence. And, how will Trump’s tariffs influence trade in the long run? Plus, Vanguard’s 50th anniversary. Later, South Korea’s baby bust — is the country’s economy at risk? (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Elon Musk’s 100-Day Bet
content:
Since Donald Trump returned to the White House, Elon Musk has been a scene-stealer, gutting agencies and sparking litigation. But DOGE hasn’t fully lived up to its billing, and Tesla has become collateral damage. 

Illustration: Christian Capestany (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Stocks Rise for Second Week as Tariff Shock Fades | Bloomberg: The Close 05/02/2025
content: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Katie Nixon, Northern Trust, Lydia Boussour, EY, Mike Wirth, Chevron CEO, Gene Munster, Deepwater Asset Management, Mark Palmer, Benchmark, Melissa Brown, Simcorp, Jay Berry, JPMorgan, Hayley Berg, Hopper, Bryan Eshelman, AlixPartners, Mac Harman, Balsam Hill, Mauricio Umansky, The Agency. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Big Oil Refuses to Budge on Production Ahead of OPEC+ Decision
content: The largest western oil producers are mostly sticking with their growth plans for now, despite a 16% decline in crude prices during April and the potential for further increases in output from OPEC+.

title: Key Federal Reserve Supervision Official to Depart at Year-End
content: Michael Gibson, director of the Federal Reserve’s supervision and regulation division, will leave at the end of the year following more than three decades at the US central bank, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Apple Renews Fears About Tariffs, China With Wobbly Report
content: Bloomberg's Mark Gurman breaks down Apple's wobbly earnings report, the impact of Trump tariffs and what they both mean for the tech giant's future. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Speculators Turn Most Bearish on the Dollar Since September
content: Speculative traders have become more bearish on the dollar than at any time since last September as concerns about US assets continue to circulate despite a recovery in the equity markets.

title: Tiny Logistics Firm’s Shares Surge on Plan to Buy Trump Coin
content: A small logistics company’s plan to hold President Donald Trump’s memecoin as a treasury asset is fueling its blistering stock rally.

title: US Treasuries Slide as Solid Jobs Market Gives Fed Room on Rates
content: US Treasuries fell after stronger-than-expected US employment data showed tariff uncertainty hasn’t hit the nation’s jobs market yet, prompting traders to trim bets on imminent interest-rate cuts.

title: Stocks Extend Winning Streak on Trade Optimism, Jobs
content: US stocks tallied a second week of gains, with the S&P 500 Index powering through its longest winning streak in more than 20 years and wiping out all losses from April’s tariff turbulence as strong jobs data and progress on international trade talks unleashed a wave of buying.

title: Stocks Surged After Solid Jobs Report | Closing Bell
content: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Alix Steel, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Emily Graffeo. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: In Wall Street’s Epic Comeback, Unsolved Market Mysteries Abound
content: It was the week Wall Street got its swagger back. Stocks staged a gravity-defying rebound to wipe out all losses from April’s tariff shock, Corporate America unleashed billions in pent-up bond sales and speculative assets from crypto to unprofitable tech companies surged.

title: I Squared Nears Deal for $5 Billion Matterhorn Pipeline
content: A consortium led by I Squared Capital is considering buying Matterhorn Express Pipeline in a deal that would value the Texas natural gas conduit at about $5 billion including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Stocks Rise for Second Week as Tariff Shock Fades: Markets Wrap
content: Wall Street’s risk-on brigade pushed the S&P 500 to its longest winning streak in two decades, with scars from April’s tariff shock healing on fresh signs of US-China diplomacy.

title: Very High Uncertainty For Consumers, Businesses: Berro
content: JPMorgan Asset Management Fixed Income Portfolio Manager discusses the current economic data in an interview with Sonali Basak on "Real Yield." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Real Yield 05/02/2025
content: Vonnie Quinn highlights the market-moving news you need to know. Today's guests: JPMorgan Asset Management Fixed Income Portfolio Manager Kelsey Berro, Oaktree Capital Management CO-CEO and Portfolio Manager Robert O'Leary, and Bloomberg's Ira Jersey. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bringing the Workforce Along With Tech Advances
content: A new initiative from ADP aims to fight the mismatch between skills and labor force needs amid rapid technological advancements. Nela Richardson, ADP chief economist and ESG officer, speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: What Does GDP Data Mean For Markets?
content: The GDP data came in lower than expected even with steady job growth in April. JPMorgan Asset Management Fixed Income Portfolio Manager Kelsey Berro and Bloomberg's Ira Jersey explain how this impacts the bond market. They speak with Sonali Basak on "Real Yield." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Apple’s China Problem Isn’t New: IDC’s Popal
content: Apple is facing a challenging year but Nabila Popal, senior director at IDC, says the company’s long-term outlook remains strong. She speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology”.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Amazon Prepares for Tougher Business Climate
content: Amazon’s seller density will be an important factor for its growth in the face of tariffs, says Brad Erickson, internet analyst at RBC Capital Markets. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Technology."  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: DC Accelerates $1.5 Billion Debt Sale Amid Investor Demand
content: The District of Columbia accelerated the sale of $1.5 billion of municipal bonds by a day, taking advantage of a rally in US state and local debt that helped buoy demand for the securities.

title: Chevron Cuts Buybacks As Oil Plunges
content: Chevron and Exxon reported high earnings even after Chevron said it would reduce it's share buybacks because of tumbling oil prices and a trade war. Meanwhile, Exxon is sticking with its's share buyback plans as it's earnings met analysts' estimates. Goldman Sachs Head of North American Natural Equity Research Neil Mehta has more on the story.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Designates Gangs Destabilizing Haiti as Terrorist Groups
content: The US designated two powerful Haitian gangs it accused of destabilizing the country and threatening US interests as “Foreign Terrorist Organizations,” escalating pressure on the groups that control much of the country’s trade.

title: Oil Falls as OPEC+ Weighs Another Major Production Increase
content: Oil slumped as OPEC+ discussed making a second major production increase, inflaming concerns about swelling global supplies that have dragged down crude prices this year.

title: Oaktree's Co-CEO on Tariff Impact, Private Credit, Bankruptcies
content: Oaktree Capital Management Co-Chief Executive Officer Robert O’Leary discusses the impact of tariffs and says it's reasonable to assume "we are in for higher and more volatile interest rates" and as a consequence of that "we're in for more volatility in the credit market." He also discusses private credit and says discounts are going as low as the “50 cent range.” Robert O’Leary joins Sonali Basak on "Real Yield." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Take-Two Delays Grand Theft Auto VI
content: Take-Two Interactive is pushing back the release of Grand Theft Auto VI to May of 2026, delaying what’s expected to be one of the most lucrative video games ever. Bloomberg's Jason Schreier discusses the reason with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology”.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Australians Vote in Election as Polls Show Labor Will Win
content: Australians began voting Saturday in an election that opinion polls said favored Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, putting him in a position to become the first leader to win consecutive ballots in more than two decades.

title: India Bans Imports From Pakistan as Tit-for-Tat Measures Widen
content: India banned the import of all goods originating from or transiting through Pakistan as tensions between the two nuclear-armed nations escalate in the wake of a deadly terror attack last month.

title: Singapore Heads to Vote in Biggest Test Yet for Ruling Party
content: Singaporeans voted Saturday in the ruling party’s biggest electoral test in decades amid concerns over global economic turmoil and high living costs in the Southeast Asian city-state.

title: Germany’s Red Tape Creates a Berlin-Sized Hole in Energy Shift
content: Military airspace restrictions are holding up wind-power projects, highlighting the challenges for Germany’s energy and defense plans.

title: Serbia’s Vucic Cuts US Visit Short on Health Reasons, RTS Says
content: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic suddenly fell sick while in Florida on Friday and will return home, canceling his planned meetings in the US, state broadcaster RTS reported.

title: Cuomo Holds $3 Million of Undisclosed Options in Nuclear Startup
content: Former New York Governor  Andrew Cuomo has $3 million in options to a shoestring nuclear startup that he failed to disclose to an ethics board as he mounts a comeback bid to be the mayor of New York City.

title: Starmer Plots Harder Line on Migration to Counter Farage Threat
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer is preparing tougher measures on immigration to stem a record flow of arrivals across the English Channel and stave off the threat posed by Nigel Farage’s Reform UK party after it made sweeping gains in this week’s local elections.

title: Transportation Department Plans to Cut Workforce at End of May
content: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy told employees in a town hall Friday that he’s planning to reduce the department’s workforce at the end of this month.

title: Key Federal Reserve Supervision Official to Depart at Year-End
content: Michael Gibson, director of the Federal Reserve’s supervision and regulation division, will leave at the end of the year following more than three decades at the US central bank, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Trump Wants to Pull Harvard’s Tax Exemption. Can He?
content: President Donald Trump is escalating his campaign to pressure elite universities into making a wide range of policy changes by threatening to strip Harvard University of its tax-exempt status.

title: Trump Will Celebrate Army’s Birthday - And His Own - With a Parade
content: President Donald Trump will host a military parade marking the 250th birthday of the US Army — as well as his own 79th birthday — on June 14, the administration announced Friday.

title: US Approves $3.5 Billion Weapons Sale to Saudi Arabia
content: The US approved the sale of weapons worth an estimated $3.5 billion to Saudi Arabia ahead of a planned visit by President Donald Trump to the Gulf kingdom this month, as Washington seeks to strengthen ties with a key partner and ratchet up pressure against Iran.

title: US Settling Suit Over Trump Supporter’s Death in Jan. 6 Riot
content: The US has reached a settlement in principle with the estate of Ashli Babbitt, the protester who was shot and killed by a police officer as she tried to force her way into the chambers of the House of Representatives during the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot.

title: US Approves Up to $350 Million in Ukraine F-16 Training, Support
content: The US State Department approved F-16 fighter-jet training and services for Ukraine worth up to $350 million, signaling that the White House will keep supporting Kyiv in the fight against Russia despite President Donald Trump’s impatience to end the war.

title: How ‘Signalgate’ Cost Michael Waltz His NSA Job
content: In March, the editor of the Atlantic magazine revealed that national security adviser Michael Waltz had inadvertently included him in a group texting thread with other top officials in President Donald Trump’s administration about a US military operation in Yemen. The revelations set off a firestorm of criticism against Waltz, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, and others in the group for discussing highly sensitive matters on Signal, a commercial messaging app that is off-limits for US officials t

title: Nigel Farage’s Reform Upends UK Politics With Election Surge
content: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK landed its biggest blow yet against Britain’s political establishment in Thursday’s local votes, winning a string of victories that highlight how the populist right-wing party is shifting Britain’s electoral landscape.

title: Door Opens a Crack for Talks With China on Tariffs
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Trump Asks Supreme Court for DOGE Access to Social Security Data
content: The Trump administration asked the US Supreme Court to let Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency have access to sensitive Social Security information, escalating a privacy fight that could affect millions of people.

title: Trump Stokes Harvard Feud by Threatening Tax-Exempt Status
content: President Donald Trump said Harvard University would lose its tax-exempt status, stepping up his attack on the Ivy League school with a threat that was decried as out of his jurisdiction.

title: NY Fires Back in Congestion Fight With Trump to Keep Toll Alive
content: New York fired a salvo in the fight to shield its congestion pricing program from the Trump administration’s push to shut it down, indicating it is now poised to seek an immediate court order in its lawsuit to protect the traffic tolling plan.

title: US Presses for Google to Share Data by Citing Yahoo Japan Deal
content: US antitrust enforcers reached back to a deal Google struck 15 years ago to argue that the Alphabet Inc. unit should once again share information with third parties, this time to end its illegal monopoly of online search.

title: Trump’s Ex-IRS Commissioner Pushes Back on Harvard Tax Attack
content: Donald Trump’s promise to strip Harvard University of its tax-exempt status prompted criticism Friday from a former Internal Revenue Service commissioner in the president’s first term, who said the process would take years and need a judge’s approval.

title: NJ Transit Strike Would Be ‘Disaster’ for Region, Sherrill Says
content: New Jersey Transit is on the brink of a “huge crisis” as a train engineers strike threatens to upend commutes as early as May 16, according to US Representative Mikie Sherrill.

title: US Sends Envoy to Monitor Romanian Election, Bucharest Says
content: President Donald Trump’s administration dispatched a senior official to Romania to monitor a contentious presidential election on Sunday, the government in Bucharest said.

title: Portugal Says Defense Investment May Have Reached 1.58% of GDP
content: Portugal’s defense investment may have reached an estimated 1.58% of gross domestic product in 2024, more than previously forecast.

title: Energy Chief Says US Won’t Move Forward With With Billions in Biden-Era Loans
content: Energy Secretary Chris Wright said his agency doesn’t plan to move forward with billions of dollars worth of Biden-era loans as the Trump administration reviews the department’s $400 billion-strong green bank.

title: FCC’s Simington Seeks to Cap Networks’ Local Revenue Share
content: Nathan Simington, a Republican member of the Federal Communications Commission, proposed capping the share of revenue that TV networks can collect from local stations, saying he wants to “rein in corporate media monopolies.”

title: Israel Hits Damascus After Plea for Help From Druze Minority
content: Israel struck a target near the presidential palace in the Syrian capital after the Druze community in both countries called for help following a series of violent clashes between the minority group and Syrian government forces.

title: Trump Seeks to Squeeze Drugmakers’ Revenues to Pay for Tax Cuts
content: President Donald Trump has set his sights on the pharmaceutical industry to shoulder part of the cost of his tax cuts, pressing congressional Republicans to force drugmakers to accept lower prices on prescriptions covered by Medicaid.

title: China Hints at Possible Thaw With US in Weighing Trade Talks
content: China said it is assessing the possibility of trade talks with the US, the first sign since Donald Trump hiked tariffs last month that negotiations could begin between the two sides.

title: Investors Eye Nigeria's Cinema Industry
content: After Netflix and Amazon stopped commissioning original films, Nigeria’s financiers spotted an opportunity to break into the industry. Nollywood, as Nigeria’s freewheeling filmmaking industry is called, is a booming business. Hard figures are difficult to come by, but the country produces the second-highest number of movies in the world every year after India, and at least a million people are estimated to work directly or indirectly in the sector. Jennifer Zabasajja reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Why Going Nuclear Is the Only Good Choice
content: Maybe two weeks?

title: Google Can Train Search AI With Web Content Even After Opt-Out
content: Google can train its search-specific AI products, like AI Overviews, on content across the web even when the publishers have chosen to opt out of training Google’s AI products, a vice-president of product at the company testified in court on Friday.

title: What’s the De Minimis Tariff Loophole That Trump Has Closed?
content: A Latin term that used to be little-known outside the world of customs brokers has become the stuff of headlines. That’s thanks to a decision by US President Donald Trump to close a tariff loophole for “de minimis” merchandise from mainland China and Hong Kong from May 2.

title: Tiny Logistics Firm’s Shares Surge on Plan to Buy Trump Coin
content: A small logistics company’s plan to hold President Donald Trump’s memecoin as a treasury asset is fueling its blistering stock rally.

title: Tariffs Weigh on Big Tech, Increasing US Energy for AI | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss a busy week of tech earnings. Plus, US Energy Secretary Chris Wright explains the Trump administration's plans to boost US electricity output to support AI development. And Roblox CEO David Baszucki talks about the company’s earnings and growth strategy. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Apple Renews Fears About Tariffs, China With Wobbly Report
content: Apple Inc.’s much-awaited quarterly earnings report failed to soothe investor concerns about its biggest challenges, including escalating tariff costs and a slowdown in China.

title: UK Grocer Co-op Says Hackers Obtained Customer Data
content: The UK supermarket chain Co-op said hackers were able to access and extract customer data from one of its systems during a recent cyberattack.

title: DOJ Asks Federal Judge to Break Up Google’s Ad-Tech Tools
content: The US Justice Department asked a federal judge on Friday to force Alphabet Inc.’s Google to sell key parts of its advertising technology and share realtime data with competitors to address a ruling that the technology giant illegally monopolizes much of the market for placing ads around the web.

title: US Presses for Google to Share Data by Citing Yahoo Japan Deal
content: US antitrust enforcers reached back to a deal Google struck 15 years ago to argue that the Alphabet Inc. unit should once again share information with third parties, this time to end its illegal monopoly of online search.

title: UK Tells Businesses to ‘Wake Up’ After Marks & Spencer Hack
content: A senior UK minister next week will warn businesses to protect themselves against cyber threats after a spate of attacks on retailers including Marks & Spencer Group Plc.

title: Players Have Too Many Options to Spend $80 on a Video Game
content: As Xbox announces a price hike, the year’s best-reviewed games are all budget titles

title: Apple, Anthropic Team Up to Build AI-Powered ‘Vibe-Coding’ Platform
content: Apple Inc. is teaming up with startup Anthropic PBC on a new “vibe-coding” software platform that will use artificial intelligence to write, edit and test code on behalf of programmers.

title: Shein’s London IPO Stalled Amid US Tariff Fallout
content: Shein Group Ltd.’s initial public offering plan has slowed to a crawl as the retailer assesses the impact of US tariffs on its business and awaits regulatory approvals, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Block Shares Sink Most in Five Years on Reduced Profit Guidance
content: Shares of Block Inc. are on a downward spiral after the parent of the popular money-transfer app Cash App reported results that suggest weakness in the company’s efforts to convert millions of active users into full-fledged banking customers.

title: Amazon Buys NYC Fifth Avenue Office Tower Near Grand Central
content: Amazon.com Inc. added to its Manhattan real estate holdings with the purchase of an office tower on Fifth Avenue.

title: Disinformation Experts Band Together as Online Abuse Escalates
content: Elon Musk's X account on a smartphone arranged in Germantown, New York, US, on Thursday, April 24, 2025. Elon Musk's X Holdings Corp. is evolving from a social media platform powered by mainstream advertisers to one betting on dollars generated from artificial intelligence and subscriptions, a change that appears to have buoyed its revenue lately. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

title: Uber, China’s Momenta to Partner on Robotaxi Rollout in Europe
content: Uber Technologies Inc. announced it’s partnering with Beijing Momenta Technology Co. to deploy robotaxis on the ridesharing platform in various global markets, starting in Europe in early 2026.

title: Why Are Deepfakes Everywhere? Can They Be Stopped?
content: The internet is awash in deepfakes — audio, pictures or video made using artificial intelligence tools in which people appear to do or say things they didn’t, be somewhere they weren’t, or that change their appearance. Some involve nudification, where photos are altered to depict someone unclothed. Other deepfakes are deployed to scam consumers, or to damage the reputations of politicians and other people in the public eye.

title: Harrods Latest UK Retailer to Battle Against Hacking Attacks
content: London’s luxury department store Harrods Ltd. reported hacking attempts Thursday, days after two other UK retailers said they were attacked.

title: Singapore Steps Up Fraud Probe Involving Nvidia’s AI Chips
content: Singaporean prosecutors secured eight more weeks to deepen a probe and potentially bring more charges against three men accused of fraud in shipping servers suspected of containing Nvidia Corp. chips banned from China.

title: Amazon, Apple Earnings Show Tariffs Are Coming for Big Tech, Too
content: Recessionary fears. Global economic and geopolitical conditions. Tariff and trade policies.

title: Apple Hit With Downgrades as Tariff, Growth Worries Increase
content: Apple Inc. received at least two downgrades on Friday, following quarterly results that reinforced concerns over tariffs and its growth potential.

title: Take-Two Delays Release of Grand Theft Auto VI to May 2026
content: Take-Two Interactive Software Inc. pushed back the release of Grand Theft Auto VI to next year, giving the team more time to finish what’s expected to be one of the most lucrative video games ever. The shares tumbled the most in two-and-a-half years.

title: Amazon Braces for Tougher Business Climate as US Tariffs Hit
content: Amazon.com Inc. said it’s bracing for a tougher business climate in the coming months, echoing concerns from a range of companies that tariffs and related economic turmoil could crimp consumer spending.

title: Amazon, Apple Show Big Tech Not Immune From Tariff Pain
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Brody Ford writes that Apple and Amazon’s quarterly results show that Big Tech can’t avoid the pain of US tariffs.

title: How an Israeli Hostage Negotiator Outsmarts Ransomware Hackers
content: Moty Cristal honed his talent for high-stakes negotiations dealing with Hamas and Hezbollah before expanding to talks with ransomware gangs.

title: TikTok Fined €530 Million for Illegally Sending EU Data to China
content: TikTok owner ByteDance Ltd. was fined €530 million ($600 million) by the European Union for illegally sending user data to China, and warned that it didn’t do enough to keep that information out of reach from Chinese state services.

title: Oyo Postpones Its Third Attempt at an IPO After SoftBank Balks
content: Oyo Hotels is delaying its plans for an October IPO after opposition from SoftBank Group Corp. and a tumultuous turn in the stock market this year.

title: Temu Ditches Chinese Imports Model to Avoid Trump’s Tariffs
content: Temu is abandoning the model centered around cheap Chinese imports that catapulted it to success in the US, aiming to sell only goods from local merchants to American consumers for the foreseeable future.

title: OpenAI Can’t Dodge Musk’s Fraud Claims in Restructuring Suit
content: A judge narrowed claims in Elon Musk’s lawsuit alleging that OpenAI broke its promise to function as a public charity by making plans to transform itself into a for-profit business.

title: What’s the De Minimis Tariff Loophole That Trump Has Closed?
content: A Latin term that used to be little-known outside the world of customs brokers has become the stuff of headlines. That’s thanks to a decision by US President Donald Trump to close a tariff loophole for “de minimis” merchandise from mainland China and Hong Kong from May 2.

title: US Black Women See Jobless Rate Surge, Adding to Year-Long Trend
content: The unemployment rate for Black women rose by a full percentage point in April, following a year-long deterioration in labor conditions for that category.

title: Portugal Says Defense Investment May Have Reached 1.58% of GDP
content: Portugal’s defense investment may have reached an estimated 1.58% of gross domestic product in 2024, more than previously forecast.

title: GM Cuts Workers at Canada Truck Plant, Citing Trade Turmoil
content: A General Motors Co. assembly plant in Canada that makes pickup trucks mostly for export to the US will cut down to two shifts from three because of the trade war.

title: China Hints at Possible Thaw With US in Weighing Trade Talks
content: China said it is assessing the possibility of trade talks with the US, the first sign since Donald Trump hiked tariffs last month that negotiations could begin between the two sides.

title: ECB Can Be Optimistic on Inflation, Guindos Tells Die Presse
content: The European Central Bank can be confident on returning inflation to the 2% goal, according to Vice President Luis de Guindos.

title: Carney, Trump Prepare to Talk Trade and Security at White House
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said he’ll meet with US President Donald Trump in Washington on Tuesday, their first face-to-face encounter since he won an election in part because of an anti-Trump message.

title: Namibia Joins Central Banks’ Gold Rush to Hedge Against Shocks
content: Namibia’s central bank plans to join others that are adding gold to their foreign-exchange reserve mix as a buffer against global uncertainty that’s intensified since US President Donald Trump slapped tariffs on its trading partners.

title: Trump’s Auto Tariff Relief Shields USMCA Auto Parts From 25% Tax
content: President Donald Trump’s revised auto tariff plan continues — at least for now — an exemption for parts that comply with the free trade agreement spanning North America, a concession desperately sought by industry.

title: Barclays Pushes Forecast for Next Fed Cut to July From June
content: Economists at Barclays delayed the timing of their predication for the Federal Reserve to cut rates to July, from June, following a stronger-than-expected payroll report.

title: Global Manufacturing Activity Contracts for First Time This Year
content: Global manufacturing activity contracted for the first time this year in April, dragged down by shrinking orders and employment.

title: Zambia, Zimbabwe Court Investors to Revive $5 Billion Hydro Dam
content: Zambia and Zimbabwe are ramping up efforts to secure investment for the long-delayed $5 billion Batoka Gorge hydropower project, as they revive a controversial plan to potentially source water from the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: US Employers Add 177,000 Jobs, Solid Pace in Face of Uncertainty
content: US job growth was robust in April and the unemployment rate held steady despite deep uncertainty over President Donald Trump’s trade policies, which economists expect will dent hiring plans over the coming months.

title: Auto Workers Welcome Trump’s Tariffs, No Matter What’s Happening on Wall Street
content: Some auto workers like James Benson Jr. are all-in on President Donald Trump’s trade war — and they don’t mind if it causes some short-term pain for both Wall Street and Main Street.

title: US Treasury Sanctions Cartel Leader in Fuel Theft Crackdown
content: The US Treasury Department announced sanctions on three Mexican nationals and two Mexican companies involved in fuel theft and smuggling by the Cartel Jalisco Nueva Generacion.

title: Bank of Ireland Starts to See a Pause in Foreign Investments
content: Some of Bank of Ireland Group Plc’s corporate and foreign direct investment customers paused investments in the first quarter because of global business uncertainty, according to the lender.

title: Chile Economic Activity Bounces Back on Mining Output Surge
content: Chile’s economic activity bounced back in March on a surge in mining, while other sectors posted more muted gains as government officials and the central bank warn of a turbulent global outlook ahead.

title: Here Are the Takeaways From the US Jobs Report for April
content: Here are the key takeaways from the US employment report for April, released Friday:

title: China Shipping Loophole Closed by Trump, Raising Prices for US Consumers
content: Small-value packages shipped to the US from China will no longer be exempted from tariffs starting Friday, when President Donald Trump’s move against an exception he called a “big scam” takes effect.

title: US Jobs Strength Unlikely to Move Fed as Trade War Looms
content: A worker moves spools of copper wire between rod breakdown machines. Photographer: Justin Hamel/Bloomberg

title: Food Inflation Heats Up But Some Relief May Be in Store
content: As worries about the impact of tariffs on the economy and consumer demand persist, there’s a sliver of good news on the horizon: The World Bank expects food commodity prices to actually drop.

title: The Ricochet Effect From Trump’s Trade War
content: I’m Craig Stirling, a senior editor in Frankfurt. Today we’re looking at the inflation impact on Europe of Chinese exports. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: Tariff Concerns Drive Global Food Prices to Two-Year High
content: Global food prices rose to a two-year high in April, a sign that tariff uncertainty is starting to put a squeeze on trade.

title: No Fed Cuts Until September Despite Rising Risks, Economists Say
content: Economists see a darkening outlook for the US economy but are sticking by projections for two interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve this year.

title: Euro-Zone Inflation Holds Above Target as ECB Weighs Cuts
content: Euro-area inflation unexpectedly held steady and an underlying measure jumped in an awkward report for officials weighing how to respond to the economic hit from US tariffs.

title: China Quietly Exempts About a Quarter of US Imports from Tariffs
content: China has quietly started to exempt some US goods from tariffs that likely cover around $40 billion worth of imports, in what looks like an effort to soften the blow of the trade war on its own economy.

title: Hong Kong’s Growth Unexpectedly Picks Up on Tourism, Export Boom
content: Hong Kong’s economy expanded at the fastest pace in more than a year, benefiting from a recovery in tourism and an export bump before Donald Trump’s drastic tariff hikes.

title: South African Factory Mood Sours in April Amid Trump Trade War
content: South African manufacturers turned more gloomy last month, blaming uncertainty fanned by global tariffs and domestic political strains.

title: Pakistan’s Inflation Slows in April Ahead of Rate Decision
content: Pakistan’s inflation slowed last month, though risks to price gains from global trade disruptions will likely keep the central bank cautious.

title: Japan Seeks US Trade Deal in June Amid Report of Standoff
content: Japan’s chief negotiator expressed hopes of reaching a trade agreement with the US in June, even as a media report indicated the two sides remained at odds on the key issue of its car exports.

title: American Airlines Sues Chicago Over O’Hare Gates for United
content: American Airlines Group Inc. sued the city of Chicago in a fight with rival United Airlines Holding Inc. over valuable gate space at O’Hare International Airport.

title: Google Can Train Search AI With Web Content Even After Opt-Out
content: Google can train its search-specific AI products, like AI Overviews, on content across the web even when the publishers have chosen to opt out of training Google’s AI products, a vice-president of product at the company testified in court on Friday.

title: JetZero’s Triangle-Shaped Jet On Track to Fly By Late 2027
content: JetZero Inc., the start-up aiming to take on planemakers Airbus SE and Boeing Co., is on track to fly the first full-scale model of its manta ray-shaped jetliner by late 2027, executives said Friday.

title: NTSB Probing Aborted Landings at Reagan Due to Army Chopper
content: The National Transportation Safety Board is investigating aborted landings by two flights into Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport due to a nearby US Army Black Hawk helicopter that was traveling to the Pentagon.

title: United to Cut Newark Operations as FAA Issues Snarl Flights
content: United Airlines Holdings Inc. will cut 35 daily round trips at Newark Liberty International Airport after Federal Aviation Administration technology failures and an air traffic controller shortage snarled flights for a full week.

title: Transportation Department Plans to Cut Workforce at End of May
content: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy told employees in a town hall Friday that he’s planning to reduce the department’s workforce at the end of this month.

title: Big Oil Refuses to Budge on Production Ahead of OPEC+ Decision
content: The largest western oil producers are mostly sticking with their growth plans for now, despite a 16% decline in crude prices during April and the potential for further increases in output from OPEC+.

title: US Approves $3.5 Billion Weapons Sale to Saudi Arabia
content: The US approved the sale of weapons worth an estimated $3.5 billion to Saudi Arabia ahead of a planned visit by President Donald Trump to the Gulf kingdom this month, as Washington seeks to strengthen ties with a key partner and ratchet up pressure against Iran.

title: US Approves Up to $350 Million in Ukraine F-16 Training, Support
content: The US State Department approved F-16 fighter-jet training and services for Ukraine worth up to $350 million, signaling that the White House will keep supporting Kyiv in the fight against Russia despite President Donald Trump’s impatience to end the war.

title: I Squared Nears Deal for $5 Billion Matterhorn Pipeline
content: A consortium led by I Squared Capital is considering buying Matterhorn Express Pipeline in a deal that would value the Texas natural gas conduit at about $5 billion including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Nike, Adidas Call on Trump to Exempt Footwear From Tariffs
content: A trade association representing footwear producers has asked the Trump administration to consider tariff exemptions for its products, saying the levies will drive up the cost of shoes in the US and cause businesses to shutter.

title: Sun Country Airlines CEO Says Demand Woes Risk Extending Into Summer
content: The pace of air travel early this summer is uncertain as consumers who drove a sharp decline in demand last quarter remain worried about the economy, the top executive of Sun Country Airlines Holdings Inc. said.

title: Chevron Cuts Buybacks and Exxon Sits Tight as Oil Plunges
content: Chevron Corp. will reduce share buybacks this quarter after oil prices tumbled, indicating that President Donald Trump’s trade war is hurting a key US industry he pledged to help.

title: GM Cuts Workers at Canada Truck Plant, Citing Trade Turmoil
content: A General Motors Co. assembly plant in Canada that makes pickup trucks mostly for export to the US will cut down to two shifts from three because of the trade war.

title: Shein’s London IPO Stalled Amid US Tariff Fallout
content: Shein Group Ltd.’s initial public offering plan has slowed to a crawl as the retailer assesses the impact of US tariffs on its business and awaits regulatory approvals, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: US Measles Cases Hit 935 as RFK Jr. Pushes Treatment Study
content: The US reported 51 new measles infections on Friday, an increase of 6% from the previous week as Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the nation’s top health official, pushed for research into unproven treatments.

title: Trump Administration Proposes Cutting $6 Billion From NASA’s Budget
content: President Donald Trump’s proposed budget for next year calls for sweeping cuts to many of NASA’s programs, including a plan to phase out the agency’s Boeing Co.-made moon rocket, reduce crews and operations on the International Space Station and gut science initiatives.

title: Trump’s Auto Tariff Relief Shields USMCA Auto Parts From 25% Tax
content: President Donald Trump’s revised auto tariff plan continues — at least for now — an exemption for parts that comply with the free trade agreement spanning North America, a concession desperately sought by industry.

title: Retailer Claire’s to Defer Debt Interest Payments Amid Tariff Tensions
content: Claire’s Stores Inc. is choosing to defer interest payments on its debt as a way to conserve cash as the US-China trade war roils retailer supply chains.

title: Norway’s Equinor Offloads Stake in Brazilian Oil Field for $3.5 Billion
content: Equinor ASA agreed to sell its 60% stake in the Peregrino oil and gas project off the Brazilian coast to PRIO SA for $3.5 billion, as the Norwegian energy explorer seeks to streamline international operations. Rio de Janeiro-based PRIO gained.

title: Xcel CEO Says AI Power Needs Boost Chance of New Big Nuclear
content: It’s been more than a decade since the US last broke ground on a large-scale nuclear power plant that came online. Xcel Chief Executive Officer Bob Frenzel is raising the idea that it’s time to start again.

title: Auto Workers Welcome Trump’s Tariffs, No Matter What’s Happening on Wall Street
content: Some auto workers like James Benson Jr. are all-in on President Donald Trump’s trade war — and they don’t mind if it causes some short-term pain for both Wall Street and Main Street.

title: Medical Equipment Makers Stryker, Becton Eye Price Hikes to Offset Tariffs
content: Medical equipment makers including Stryker Corp. and Becton Dickinson & Co. are looking to pass on at least some of the estimated tariff hit to customers by raising prices.

title: Wendy’s Adds to Restaurant Woes on ‘Challenging’ US Market
content: Wendy’s Co. lowered its sales outlook for this year, the latest restaurant chain to take a hit from consumer unease about shaky economic conditions in the US.

title: Diamond’s Atlas Raises About $150 Million for Regional-Bank Bets
content: Bob Diamond’s Atlas Merchant Capital raised roughly $150 million so far for a fund dedicated to investing in US regional banks, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: How an Israeli Hostage Negotiator Outsmarts Ransomware Hackers
content: Moty Cristal honed his talent for high-stakes negotiations dealing with Hamas and Hezbollah before expanding to talks with ransomware gangs.

title: Japan’s Buffett-Backed Trading Houses Brace for Tariff Impact
content: Major Japanese trading houses, backed by Warren Buffett, this week released cautious profit forecasts for the year, setting aside millions to hedge against persistent tariff uncertainty.

title: Shell Shows Its Strength by Sticking to Plans Amid Oil Downturn
content: Shell Plc stood out from its peers by sticking to plans for investor returns and capital spending even as oil prices entered what could be a prolonged downturn.

title: Cigna Lifts Forecast After Quarterly Profit, Sales Top Estimates
content: Cigna Group raised its annual forecast and posted first-quarter earnings that beat Wall Street expectations, offering reassurance to investors still rattled by UnitedHealth Group Inc.’s shock forecast cut.

title: Gold Fields in Talks to Acquire Australian Miner Gold Road
content: Gold Fields Ltd. said it’s in talks to acquire Gold Road Resources Ltd., hours after the Australian company’s shares were suspended from trading in Sydney, following media speculation over a deal.

title: Your AI-powered credit card will shop for you now
content: We're not lazy enough, so Visa and Mastercard have hired AI personal assistants to do our shopping

title: Elon Musk, DOGE team credit fed workers for helping trim waste, fraud
content: Elon Musk and his DOGE team expressed their gratitude Thursday to the federal employees partnering with the cost-cutting agency as they work around the clock to eliminate wasteful spending and modernize the workforce.

title: Legislators propose upgraded tax credit for short line rail maintenance
content: New legislation would upgrade a federal tax credit short line railroads depend on for infrastructure spending.

title: Subscription scams surge across hundreds of fake websites - how to stay safe
content: Subscription scams are popping up on social media sites, attempting to trick users out of their credit card information.

title: Trump praises Gov. Gretchen Whitmer while at Michigan air base
content: Trump announced a new series of fighter jets for the Selfridge Air National Guard base in Michigan, giving credit in part to Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer.

title: Can't make your credit card payments this May? Here's what to do.
content: At risk of falling behind on your credit card bills this May? Here's what to do before your debt and fees spiral.

title: Best Credit Cards for Cashback & Rewards in 2025 [Expert Picks]
content: In this guide, we break down the best credit cards for cashback and rewards in 2025, handpicked for U.S. consumers looking to get the most out of every dollar

title: 7 Simple Steps to Improve Your Credit Score Fast
content: If you are wondering how to improve your credit score fast, the key lies in taking targeted actions that have immediate impact. Start by paying off

title: ‘King of All Pimps’ — who recruited then-NY Gov. Eliot Spitzer hooker Ashley Dupré — claims his reputation was trashed by murder claim
content: A notorious pimp who took credit for recruiting Ashley Dupré, the hooker whose tryst with then-Gov. Eliot Spitzer ended the "Luv Guv's" career, claims in a lawsuit that a YouTuber has ruined his rep.

title: The U.S. states where auto loan delinquency is rising the most
content: Falling behind on car payments can lead to repossession and long-term credit damage

title: US agencies open probe after two Washington flights abort landings due to Army helicopter
United to cancel 10% of daily flights from Newark, cites FAA staffing, equipment
Fly with a smile: Brazil airlines cheer Lady Gaga-driven demand
Wall Street stocks buoyed by strong economic data, possible US-China trade talks
Ben & Jerry's cites investor Peltz's growing influence over parent company Unilever
Exclusive-HSBC Asset Management's global head of sustainability to depart
China low-value package exemption ends with questions over US tariff collections, logistics
US State Dept OKs possible sale of F-16 training, sustainment for Ukraine
Big Oil earnings show split in production strategy, shareholder returns

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced an award of approximately $6 million to joint whistleblowers who provided new information that led to the opening of an examination and provided a roadmap for an enforcement action that resulted in…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission’s Small Business Capital Formation Advisory Committee announced that its meeting on Tuesday, May 6, 2025, will focus on the practical market considerations and regulatory challenges of Regulation A. Members of the…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced a two-year extension of the effective and compliance dates for rule amendments adopted in August 2024 that require many types of registered funds to more frequently report portfolio-related…

title: SEC’s Anti-Fraud Public Service Campaign Warns Investors About Relationship Investment Scams
content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

title: SEC Publishes New Data and Analysis About Registered Investment Companies and Money Market Funds
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today published new data and analysis in a pair of reports that provide the investing public with updated key information about registered investment companies and money market funds.

title: By Building Wealth, Investors Power U.S. Economy
content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

title: SEC Charges Three Arizona Individuals with Defrauding Investors in $284 Million Municipal Bond Offering That Financed Sports Complex
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged Randall “Randy” Miller, Chad Miller, and Jeffrey De Laveaga with creating false documents that were provided to investors in two municipal bond offerings that raised $284 million to build one of the…

title: SEC Votes to End Defense of Climate Disclosure Rules
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today voted to end its defense of the rules requiring disclosure of climate-related risks and greenhouse gas emissions.

SEC Acting Chairman Mark T. Uyeda said, “The goal of today’s Commission action and…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Four More Roundtables
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will hold four more roundtables in its ongoing series discussing crypto asset regulation.

title: SEC Announces Agenda, Panelists for Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the agenda and panelists for the March 27 roundtable on artificial intelligence in the financial industry.  

“I look forward to hearing from the panelists on how emerging technologies,…

title: SEC Charges New Jersey Investment Adviser and His Firm with Fraud and Other Violations
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that it has filed charges against David Yow Shang Chiueh of East Hanover, New Jersey and his investment advisory firm, Upright Financial Corp., for misconduct and for investing more than 25…

title: SEC Extends Compliance Dates for Amendments to Investment Company Names Rule
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced a six-month extension of the compliance dates for amendments adopted in September 2023 to the Investment Company Act “Names Rule,” which addresses fund names likely to mislead investors about a fund’…

title: SEC Charges Investment Adviser and Two Officers for Misuse of Fund and Portfolio Company Assets
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today filed settled charges against registered investment adviser Momentum Advisors LLC, its former managing partner Allan J. Boomer, and its former chief operating officer and partner Tiffany L. Hawkins, for…

title: Filer Transition to New and Improved EDGAR Begins March 24
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission is providing extensive guidance and resources to assist filers with upcoming access and account management enhancements to the security of the agency’s Electronic Data Gathering, Analysis, and Retrieval (EDGAR)…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Roundtable on Security Status
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

title: SEC Staff Facilitates Capital Formation for Companies Planning Public Offerings
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that its Division of Corporation Finance is further facilitating capital formation by enhancing the accommodations available to companies for nonpublic review of draft registration statements.

In…

title: Commissioner Hester Peirce Announces Crypto Task Force Staff
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the members of the Crypto Task Force staff, which is advising the Commission on matters related to crypto.



The task force is composed of staff from the Acting Chairman’s office and other divisions…

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: SEC Announces Dismissal of Civil Enforcement Action Against Coinbase
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that the Commission has filed a joint stipulation with Coinbase Inc. and Coinbase Global Inc. to dismiss the ongoing civil enforcement action against the two entities.

On January 21, 2025, the…

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Seed Funding Rose In These Spaces
content: Even as overall seed-stage investment declined in 2024, a few areas saw big gains. This includes the obvious category — AI — as well as a subset of sectors largely focused on automating things that humans currently do. We take a look at four top picks.

title: Seed Funding Fell Hard In These Sectors
content: U.S. seed-stage investment actually declined a bit last year, particularly in a handful of industries including several beset by disappointing performance of startups funded in recent prior years. We take a look.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
